questions.text: In the current scenario treatment for urea cycle disorder is available. Administration of phenylbutyrate can decrease ammonia formation, which amino acid provide ammonia to phenyl butyrate?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Glutamate Administration of phenylbutyrate can decrease ammonia formation by providing ammonia to Glutamine. In the above question Glutamine is not given as an option, so best possible answer will be Glutamate.

Highyeild:

Acylation Therapy/ Ammonia Scavenging Agents

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Arginine is an incorrect option. Option: C. Aspartate is an incorrect option. Option D. Glycine is also an incorrect option.

questions.text: Which among the following are appropriate techniques for chromosomal aneuploidy? In situ hybridisation Conventional cytogenetics Sanger sequencing Polymerase chain reaction Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1, 2, 3, 4 All options are correct.

Highyeild:

Techniques to Detect Aneuploidy Conventional cytogenetics- Karyotyping Molecular cytogenetics- FISH QF PCR or Real Time PCR- Rapid aneuploidy detection Array comparative genomic hybridization (Array CGH) Multiplex Ligation dependent Probe amplification. Simple sangers sequencing cannot detect aneuploidy unless massive parallel sequencing is done.

questions.text: Match the following with appropriate precursor: Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1-b 2-d 3-a 4-c Correct combination is Option A.

Highyeild:

Melanin is the pigment of hair and skin; it is synthesized from Tyrosine. Melatonin is a neurotransmitter synthesized from tryptophan. Glutathione is a tripeptide. It is gamma glutamyl cysteinyl glycine. It is involved in erythrocyte membrane integrity and is important in keeping enzymes in active state Melatonin Tryptophan Histamine Histidine Norepinephrine Tyrosine Glutathione Cysteine

questions.text: Nutritional deficiency of Copper, required by lysyl oxidase which is an important key step for formation of covalent cross linking in collagen synthesis, gives rise to which of the following condition:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Menke's disease Nutritional deficiency of Copper, required by lysyl oxidase gives rise to Menke's disease.

Highyeild:

Menke’s Disease Copper is a constituent of lysyl oxidase. It oxidizes four lysine residues together to form desmosine which makes cross linkages in elastin. In copper deficiency, elastin becomes abnormal, leading to weakening of walls of major blood vessels. Menke’s kinky hair syndrome It is an x-linked defect (affects only male child). It is a condition in which dietary copper is absorbed from GI tract; but cannot be transported to blood due to absence of an intracellular copper binding ATPase (mutation inATP7A gene). Copper is not mobilized from intestinal cells as well as in other tissue cells. The copper that has entered into the cell is not able to get out of the cells, and so it is accumulated. Hence, copper is not available for metabolism, resulting in defective cross-linking of connective tissue. Vascular and connective tissues are affected, and child dies usually in infancy.

Random:

Explanation for other options: - Option: B. Scurvy occurs due to deficiency of Vitamin C. Option: C. In Ehler danlos syndrome loose, unstable, hypermobile joints are seen. Option: D. Scoliosis is a spinal deformity that causes an abnormal curve in the spine, usually in the shape of an S or C.

questions.text: Enzyme used in recombinant DNA technology are: Isomerase Phosphatase Terminal transferase Crispr Cas 9 Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

2,3,4 All the enzymes mentioned above are used in Recombinant DNA Technology.

Highyeild:

Enzymes Used In Recombinant DNA Technology Enzyme Reaction Primary Use Phosphatases Dephosphorylates 5' ends of RNA and DNA Removal of 5’-PO 4 groups prior to kinase labeling; also used to prevent self-ligation DNA ligate Catalyzes bonds between DNA molecules Joining of DNA molecules DNA polymerase 1 Synthesizes double-stranded DNA from single-stranded DNA Synthesis of double-stranded cDNA; DNA labeling and nick translation; generation of blunt ends from sticky ends Thermostable DNA polymerases Synthesize DNA at elevated temperatures (60-80°C) Polymerase chain reaction (DNA synthesis), mutagenesis DNase I Under appropriate conditions, produces single-stranded nicks in DNA Nick translation; mapping of hypersensitive sites, mapping protein-DNA interactions Exonuclease III Removes nucleotides from 3’ ends of DNA DNA sequencing: ChIP-Exe, mapping of DNA-protein interactions λ Exonuclease Removes nucleotides from 5’ ends of DNA sequencing, mapping of DNA-protein interactions Polynucleotide kinase Transfers terminal phosphate (y position) from ATP to 5-OH groups of DNA or RNA Pend-labeling of DNA or RNA Reverse transcriptase Synthesizes DNA from RNA template Synthesis of CDNA from mRNA, RNA (5' end) mapping studies RNAse H Degrades the RNA portion of a DNA-RNA hybrid Synthesis of cDNA from mRNA 51 nuclease Degrades single-stranded DNA Removal of "hairpin" in synthesis of cDNA, RNA mapping studies (both 5’ and 3' ends) Terminal transferase Adds nucleotides to the 3' ends of DNA Homopolymer tailing Recombinases (CRE, INT, FLP) Catalyze site-specific recombination between DNA containing homologous target sequences Generation of specific chimeric DNA molecules, work both in vitro and in vivo CRISPER-Cas9/C2c2 RNA-targeted DNA-, or RNA-directed nuclease Genome editing and with variations modulation of gene expression at DNA and RNA levels

questions.text: Cytochrome C oxidase present in ETC can be blocked by all except?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Nitric Oxide The action of Cytochrome C oxidase is blocked by carbon monoxide, cyanide, and hydrogen sulfide, and this causes poisoning by preventing cellular respiration. Nitric oxide does not block Cytochrome C oxidase.

Highyeild:

Etc Complexes Complex I NADH COQ Reductase Complex II Succinate CoQ Reductase Complex III Cytochrome C Reductase Complex IV Cytochrome C Oxidase (Prosthetic group is Cu) Inhibitors Of Etc Complexes: Complex Inhibitor I Rotenone, Phenobarbitone II Malonate (3C) III Phenformin IV CO, CN, H 2 S
